parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to official electoral campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post mentions UDMR (Uniunea Democrată Maghiară din România), a political party participating in the parliamentary elections. However, it does not refer to a specific candidate by name or surname.  While it indirectly relates to a candidate through party affiliation, it doesn't directly identify a specific individual as required by Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience.  The use of hashtags further suggests an attempt to broaden its reach beyond a personal communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post promotes a vision for education reform ("Vrem un stat în care școala înseamnă educație reală și aplicată, un loc fără pariuri, droguri și bullying"). While this is a policy position that could influence voters' choices, the connection to a specific candidate or party's electoral platform is indirect. The primary objective seems to be promoting the party's general stance on education, rather than directly urging voters to support a particular candidate.  The hashtag #alegevocearauniunii further reinforces the party's identity, but doesn't explicitly call for a vote for a specific candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post could be interpreted as a form of political communication, expressing the party's views on a societal issue. However, it lacks the objectivity and journalistic standards expected in news reporting or analysis. It presents a specific viewpoint rather than presenting balanced information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post doesn't express a personal opinion; it conveys a political party's policy position.  The context is clearly political communication, not a personal statement.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2099866653743220</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while related to a political party participating in the elections, does not explicitly advocate for a specific candidate or directly urge voters to vote for or against anyone.  The content focuses on a policy position (education reform) rather than directly influencing the vote.  The absence of a CMF number further weakens the case for it being direct electoral propaganda. While the post is clearly political in nature and aims to promote the UDMR's image, it doesn't meet all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The argument against it being electoral propaganda is stronger than the argument for it.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>UDMR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
